title.native: 薬屋のひとりごと 第2期

description:
The second season of Kusuriya no Hitorigoto.

Maomao and Jinshi face palace intrigue as a pregnant concubine's safety and a looming conspiracy collide.

(Source: Crunchyroll News)

tags.name: Medicine
tags.description: Centered around the activities of people working in the field of medicine.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Ancient China
tags.description: Setting in ancient china, does not apply to fantasy settings.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

tags.name: Asexual
tags.description: Features a character who isn't sexually attracted to people of any sex or gender.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Aromantic
tags.description: Features a character who experiences little to no romantic attraction.

tags.name: Pregnancy
tags.description: Features pregnant female characters or discusses the topic of pregnancy.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

node.description: Formerly affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/OLM), now affiliated with ARED.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hitomiogawa_) Not to be confused with the [background artist](https://anilist.co/staff/197642). Hitomi Ogawa is a scriptwriter.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miso_katsu)

A Japanese character designer and animation supervisor.

__Origin:__ Perth, Australia
__Alma Mater:__ Royal College of Music (2015)

[Website](https://www.kpenkmusic.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kevinpenkin) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kevinpenkincomposer) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kpenkin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCD05wgzXUYvA7rIE3XGfFFg) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/kevinpenkin) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_Penkin)

An Australian anime composer and video game composer. He is best known for composing the award-winning score to the anime [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/).

Penkin grew up in Perth, Australia. His interest in game music came from listening to the "Phendrana Drifts" theme from Metroid Prime; in a 2012 interview, he referred to the theme's electronic synths and acoustic instruments as "absolute bliss." Penkin began his career with composition credits in the 2011 short films Play Lunch and The Adventures of Chipman and Biscuit Boy. In the same year, Penkin composed the soundtrack of the video game Jūzaengi: Engetsu Sangokuden; this soundtrack represented Penkin's first collaboration with [Nobuo Uematsu](https://anilist.co/staff/100150). Penkin has continued to collaborate with Uematsu in titles such as Norn9 and Defender’s Quest II: Mists of Ruin.

In 2015, Penkin graduated from the Royal College of Music with a Master's degree in Composition for Screen. In 2016, Penkin collaborated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/) on the [Norn9](https://anilist.co/anime/20643/) anime and the [Under the Dog](https://anilist.co/anime/21002/) original video animation soundtracks. Penkin's relationship with Kinema Citrus continued through to 2017 for the soundtrack of [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/), winning the 2017 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it. In 2018, Penkin composed the score for the video game Florence. Penkin composed the music for Kinema Citrus' adaptation of [The Rising of the Shield Hero](https://anilist.co/anime/99263/) and NetEase's VR game Nostos in 2019. Penkin most recently composed the music for the 2020 anime adaptation of the South Korean webtoon [Tower of God](https://anilist.co/anime/115230/), winning the 2021 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it.

He used to live in the United Kingdom, but currently resides in Melbourne, Australia.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Twitter (Alisa Okehazama)](https://twitter.com/aliiisa_ok) | [Twitter (Alisa Fukami)](https://twitter.com/alisa_024) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/%E6%A1%B6%E7%8B%AD%E9%96%93%E3%81%82%E3%82%8A%E3%81%95-100315608634523/) | [SoundCloud (Alisa Fukami)](https://soundcloud.com/alisafukami) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6VMGyvtQPQ1uPvkaSm73aR?si=NT2wdnG2Sy60driRfdIQdw) | [AppleMusic](https://music.apple.com/jp/artist/alisa-okehazama/1548614368) | [Blog](https://profiee.com/i/alisa_oke) | [Weibo](http://weibo.com/okehazama)

Alisa Okehazama, alternatively known as Alisa Fukami is a Japanese composer and arranger

[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/kosaki) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_kosaki)

A Japanese composer and arranger. He joined NAMCO as a soundtrack composer in 1999, and then he joined MONACA Inc. as a music designer in 2004.

Soundtracks he has worked on credited as MONACA: 
- Star Driver: Kagayaki no Takuto (with Keigo Hoashi and Ryuichi Takada) 
- Hourou Musuko (with Keigo Hoashi and Keiichi Okabe) 
- A-Channel (with Kakeru Ishihama, Ryuichi Takada, Keigo Hoashi)

[Website](https://lilasikuta.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikutalilas) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lilasikuta/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCztEY6czNyJKjRWMwuur9bg) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1qM11R4ylJyQiPJ0DffE9z)

Lilas Ikuta is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and member of the music duo [YOASOBI](https://anilist.co/staff/194287/). She is also formerly a member of PLUSONICA and a 4th Generation member of the LESSON, a program made by Sony Music Japan that bases sending artists out into the world, and they draw out each student's potential and give them a thorough lesson on how to become an artist.
__Keiji Oota__ is a Japanese producer and animation planner. Managing Director at Toho.
